page.title: 11BARBROOK RESERVOIR
page.content: Barbrook Reservoir is situated on high moorland to the west of Holmesfield, near Owler Bar.It is 8.2m deep and provides half a million gallons a day to Northern Chesterfield.This would supply about 5,000 homes.The{reservoir is owned by the Severn Trent Water Authority.It is built on peat moorland,has an embankment with a clay core and has a{weir}to disperse excess water.It was built in 1910, uses gravity to feed the water and treats the water with chlorine,lime and sulphur dioxide.The{acid water will not support plant or fish life. The area is good for the observation of migratory birds.The clear,treated water is stored in tanks,one underground ,for use when the {filtration system}is undergoing its daily clean.The only source of electricity is a diesel generator.
